Ypsilon

The Ypsilon system is home to a single G-class star, Ypsilon, which is surrounded by a vast circumstellar disc densely populated with material-rich asteroids. This asteroid belt has garnered significant attention from researchers and explorers, as it presents a wealth of opportunities for mining and resource extraction. However, the asteroid belt also presents numerous challenges, including the presence of debris fields and hazardous conditions that can pose significant risks to spacecraft and explorers.

Ypsilon-14

Ukweli-4

Ukweli-4 was a top-secret research facility built to study a mysterious meteorite with an unknown and never before seen color. The facility was located on a C-Type asteroid, and its entrance was a tunnel bored directly into the asteroid's surface.
